verses.roman:
tabe gopīnātha dui-prabhure bhikṣā karāila
prabhura śeṣa prasādānna sabe bāṅṭi' khāila

synonyms: tabe—thereupon; gopīnātha—Gopīnātha Ācārya; dui-prabhure—unto the two Lords Caitanya Mahāprabhu and Nityānanda Prabhu; bhikṣā karāila—gave prasāda to eat; prabhura—of the Lord; śeṣa—the remnants; prasāda-anna—food; sabe—all of them; bāṅṭi'-sharing; kbāila—ate.
translation: Gopīnātha Ācārya then brought prasāda for the two Lords to eat, and after They had eaten, the remnants of the food were distributed to all the devotees.
